trans-unit.source: HttpProtocolHandler thread is started with the accepted TcpClientConnection. HttpProtocolHandler is responsible for parsing incoming client request and invoking HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin lifecycle hooks.
trans-unit.target: HttpProtocolHandler thread is started with the accepted TcpClientConnection. HttpProtocolHandler is responsible for parsing incoming client request and invoking HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin lifecycle hooks.
--ca-* flags enable TLS Interception.

trans-unit.source: --num-workersAcceptor processes are started by AcceptorPool on start-up.
trans-unit.target: --num-workers Acceptor processes are started by AcceptorPool on start-up.

trans-unit.source: --open-file-limit flag is a no-op on Windows operating systems.
trans-unit.target: --open-file-limit flag is a no-op on Windows operating systems.

trans-unit.source: --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin enables CacheResponsesPlugin so that we can inspect intercepted traffic
trans-unit.target: --plugins proxy.plugin.CacheResponsesPlugin enables CacheResponsesPlugin so that we can inspect intercepted traffic

trans-unit.source: -v /tmp/ca-certificates:/tmp/ca-certificates flag mounts our CA certificate directory in container environment
trans-unit.target: -v /tmp/ca-certificates:/tmp/ca-certificates flag mounts our CA certificate directory in container environment

trans-unit.source: :8900 is chosen in ascii art for differentiation purposes.
trans-unit.target: :8900 is chosen in ascii art for differentiation purposes.

trans-unit.source: AcceptorPool listens on server socket and pass the handler to Acceptor processes. Workers are responsible for accepting new client connections and starting HttpProtocolHandler thread.
trans-unit.target: AcceptorPool listens on server socket and pass the handler to Acceptor processes. Workers are responsible for accepting new client connections and starting HttpProtocolHandler thread.
HttpProtocolHandler threads are started by Acceptor processes.

trans-unit.source: HttpProxyPlugin which implements HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin also has its own plugin mechanism. Its responsibility is to establish connection between client and upstream TcpServerConnection and invoke HttpProxyBasePlugin lifecycle hooks.
trans-unit.target: HttpProxyPlugin which implements HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin also has its own plugin mechanism. Its responsibility is to establish connection between client and upstream TcpServerConnection and invoke HttpProxyBasePlugin lifecycle hooks.

trans-unit.source: Loaded plugin - proxy.py will load proxy.http.proxy.HttpProxyPlugin by default. As name suggests, this core plugin adds http(s) proxy server capabilities to proxy.py
trans-unit.target: Loaded plugin - proxy.py will load proxy.http.proxy.HttpProxyPlugin by default. As name suggests, this core plugin adds http(s) proxy server capabilities to proxy.py

trans-unit.source: Port 8899 - Use --port flag to customize default TCP port.
trans-unit.target: Port 8899 - Use --port flag to customize default TCP port.
Python3 only.

trans-unit.source: Started N workers - Use --num-workers flag to customize number of worker processes. By default, proxy.py will start as many workers as there are CPU cores on the machine.
trans-unit.target: Started N workers - Use --num-workers flag to customize number of worker processes. By default, proxy.py will start as many workers as there are CPU cores on the machine.

trans-unit.source: Started server on ::1:8899 - By default, proxy.py listens on IPv6 ::1, which is equivalent of IPv4 127.0.0.1. If you want to access proxy.py externally, use --hostname :: or --hostname 0.0.0.0 or bind to any other interface available on your machine.
trans-unit.target: Started server on ::1:8899 - By default, proxy.py listens on IPv6 ::1 , which is equivalent of IPv4 127.0.0.1 . If you want to access proxy.py externally, use --hostname :: or --hostname 0.0.0.0 or bind to any other interface available on your machine.

trans-unit.target: proxy.py running on the localhost handles and responds to remote proxy requests.

trans-unit.source: proxy.py server will listen on a random available port on the system. This random port is available as self.PROXY_PORT within your test cases.
trans-unit.target: proxy.py server will listen on a random available port on the system. This random port is available as self.PROXY_PORT within your test cases.

trans-unit.source: remote and localhost ports CAN be same e.g. :8899.
trans-unit.target: remote and localhost ports CAN be same e.g. :8899 .

trans-unit.source: remote server MUST be configured to proxy HTTP(s) requests through the forwarded port number e.g. :8900.
trans-unit.target: remote server MUST be configured to proxy HTTP(s) requests through the forwarded port number e.g. :8900 .

trans-unit.target: socket_connection is a convenient decorator + context manager around new_socket_connection which ensures conn.close is implicit.

trans-unit.source: start is a context manager. It will start proxy.py when called and will shut it down once scope ends.
trans-unit.target: start is a context manager. It will start proxy.py when called and will shut it down once scope ends.

trans-unit.source: start is similar to main, except start won't block.
trans-unit.target: start is similar to main , except start won't block.

trans-unit.source: Plugins are called in the same order as they are passed. Example, say we are using both FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin and RedirectToCustomServerPlugin. Idea is to drop all incoming http requests for google.com and www.google.com and redirect other http requests to our inbuilt web server.
trans-unit.target: Plugins are called in the same order as they are passed. Example, say we are using both FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin and RedirectToCustomServerPlugin . Idea is to drop all incoming http requests for google.com and www.google.com and redirect other http requests to our inbuilt web server.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes you may see None:None in access logs. It simply means that an upstream server connection was never established i.e. upstream_host=None, upstream_port=None.

trans-unit.source: There also is a --disable-http-proxy flag. It disables inbuilt proxy server. Use this flag with --enable-web-server flag to run proxy.py as a programmable http(s) server. HttpProxyPlugin also implements HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin.
trans-unit.target: There also is a --disable-http-proxy flag. It disables inbuilt proxy server. Use this flag with --enable-web-server flag to run proxy.py as a programmable http(s) server. HttpProxyPlugin also implements HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin .

trans-unit.source: Viola!!! If you remove CA flags, encrypted data will be found in the cached file instead of plain text.
trans-unit.target: ¡¡Viola!! Si eliminas las banderas CA,los datos encriptados se encontrarán en el archivo caché en lugar de texto plano.

trans-unit.source: We also enabled inbuilt web server using --enable-web-server. Inbuilt web server implements HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin plugin. See documentation of HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin for available lifecycle hooks. Use HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin to add new features for http(s) clients. Example, HttpWebServerPlugin.
trans-unit.target: We also enabled inbuilt web server using --enable-web-server . Inbuilt web server implements HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin plugin. See documentation of HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin for available lifecycle hooks. Use HttpProtocolHandlerPlugin to add new features for http(s) clients. Example, HttpWebServerPlugin.

trans-unit.source: We enabled proxy server plugins using --plugins flag. All the plugin examples were implementing HttpProxyBasePlugin. See documentation of HttpProxyBasePlugin for available lifecycle hooks. Use HttpProxyBasePlugin to modify behavior of http(s) proxy protocol between client and upstream server. Example, FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin.
trans-unit.target: We enabled proxy server plugins using --plugins flag. All the plugin examples were implementing HttpProxyBasePlugin . See documentation of HttpProxyBasePlugin for available lifecycle hooks. Use HttpProxyBasePlugin to modify behavior of http(s) proxy protocol between client and upstream server. Example, FilterByUpstreamHostPlugin.
